Recipe Alert!

I’m ready for colder days because I’ve got this recipe to fall back on, my favourite, your favorite - the Loyal lentils!
The blog has morphed into a new form, less of a blog and more like something else, well you have to wait and see ☺️, It’s almost done, until then I’ll release new and old recipes everyday from now on.
You can access single recipes via the link in my profile. The recipe for the Loyal Lentil Chili is also available in my book Bowls of Goodness.

Are you planning your Midwinter Feasts yet?

You might want to make space for these Herbed Lentil Meatballs with green peppercorn gravy 😋 on your menu!
I thought I should tell you that I dedicated a whole chapter to this seasons holiday tables in my latest book Feasts of Veg! All recipes are not only incredibly delicious 😉 they’re also vegan friendly and easy to adjust for gluten sensitivity ❤️ And there’s lots more to choose from for the season; spiced drinks, winter salads, roasts 💪, gratins, and sweet endings like an irresistible velvet chocolate cake. -
At the moment amazon is doing a drive on my books (and others) so if you order while the price is low, you can get a copy for 50 % off the original price 💫

Caramelised Tofu Tip!

So this is a sort of Sushi Bowl! I’m going away soon so I’m using up bits and pieces in the fridge and with a block of tofu left to use I felt like making a bowl with a mix of japan inspired flavors: so here’s: onigiri (had leftover sushi rice), carrot miso dip, roasted aubergine and sweet potato (I roasted a whole bunch of veggies earlier this week, which helped with making this meal ready within only 15,minutes) -
-

My go-to cooking method for tofu is to fry the pieces with just a little bit of oil on medium heat, not turning until there’s a dried up slightly crispy surface underneath. When all sides are crisp I splash on a prepared soy mixture sauce, only a few tablespoons and turn up the heat for a short spell, just to let the soy mixture dry up and be absorb into the tofu. and then it needs to be served straight away. -
-

The soy mixture is often very simple and add-ins can vary, but usually I add a small amount of something sweet for a caramelised flavour, like coconut sugar or agave syrup. I vary between adding black pepper, sesame oil, tahini or homemade hoisin sauce, chili, garlic and ginger. -
-

In case you want to make parts of this bowl at home, there’s recipes for the onigiri (rice ball) tsukemono (Japanese style pickles), furikake, roasted veg and Aubergine in my book Feasts of Veg, the carrot miso dip is from Bowls of Goodness. -
-
-

Would you like the recipe? -
..... for this amazing beet salad with apple, rosé vinaigrette and a cheesy cashew cream will be so beautiful on the Winter Feast table but it’s also a lovely side on a weekday next to a curry or a ragu!
I’m extra much into beets right now after my bouts of low immunity this fall I’m feeding my self organ aiding lightly cleansing veggies. So it’s been colourful days here, green spirulina smoothies and turmeric lattes. The whole rainbow in use. -
Also. This is one of my favorite plates and it’s made by @annemiekebootsceramics -

Do you sprinkle stuff on your bowls too?

I’m back home in a much colder Netherlands and plotting my workday with a good bowl of Savoury granola, yoghurt, Spirulina Gomasio, and wilted Spinach whilst sipping on a moringa smoothie and dirty chai espresso latte.
I love my savoury sprinkles and use a mixture of sea weed, nuts and seeds and other texture adding and savory bits to top my meals. Its not ready to eat before there’s some crunch on the top!

I posted a simple recipe for spirulina gomasio in my stories today if you like to give it a go.
Also first time using this beautiful red clay bowl that I bought in @quince_bali -
-
-
#cleanbowl #bowlsofgoodness #spirulina #gomasio #nourishbowl #kraut #onmytable #smoothie #todayfood #thechalkboardeats #healthyish #savourygranola #coyo #healthyfats #plantbasedprotein #breakfast #huffposttaste #buzzfeedhealth #mindbodygreen #tastespotting #veganbowls

Inspired by Sarah @wellandfull wellandfull ‘s vibrant chickpea and avocado bowl that she posted recently, I made my own spinoff with what I had in the fridge for lunch today. ✨👇🏼
So here’s what went into this bowl; toasted Cavolo Nero with fresh spinach, kasha (toasted buckwheat, leftover baked pumpkin, hot chickpeas, a cheesy cashew sauce with garlic, lemon and chives l. Plus a sprinkle of walnuts, nutritional yeast and hemp seeds (nutritional heart is addictive like crack if you have a good brand). There’s also a bit of turmeric kraut in there.
What do you always add to your mixed bowls? -
-
-

#kale #chickpeas #nourishatelier #wholefoodsplantbased #bowlsofgoodness #vegetariano #nourishyourself #healthyfood #mindfuleating #saveurmag #avocado #avocado🥑 #plantpowered #plantbased #buzzfeast #heresmyfood #f52grams

A Monday bowl, we have dark skies outside but the colour explosion happening in this bowl lit up the lunch. Lots of veggies and black rice drizzled with a hot tahini and cashew dressing.
-
-
Is it expensive to eat well? For a new project I’m thinking about healthy food, lifestyle and economy. If you have any thoughts on this, please share, is there something you love to splurge on or a health food that you find ridiculously over valued? 🍀
-
-
From one thing to another If you’re interested there’s a podcast with me and Kimberly talking Instagram 📸 and cookbooks📚 on her blog @thelittleplantation , link in my stories, also an episode with Kim’s sister who started a vegan donut business 🍩🌱

Sunday taco breakfast! Stuffed tortillas with spicy lentils and fresh veggies. I just taught our youngest and his best friend how to make these on their own, and they loved it. I’m using the same home made taco spice mix that can be found in my books.
For the later part of this day I’m going to put my phone on airplane mode and spend time outdoors. Wishing you all a beautiful Sunday 🌟✨ -

This place and its lovely people inspire me! Everything served or sold in @quince_bali is made with love and care. Like the handmade ceramics and textiles in the shop, im not a big time shopper but this is the kind of business I love to support, small and passionate about craft and quality, and now I didn’t even mention the creative menu in the cafe yet, it’s another post for another visit. Thanks for a lovely afternoon Michelle with family! -
-

Who wants a Noodle bowl 🍝
-
-

This was so tasty, comforting, creamy and nourishing! Soba Noodles with coconut milk and Thai red curry, cauliflower, crispy tofu, cauliflower and 3 cabbages! Braised Chinese cabbage with wilted spinach and toasted cavolo Nero (bomb flavour) plus kimchi! And some peanuts for the crunch , adding texture to the slurpy noodles 😋 -

Have a lovely beautiful weekend Everyone!
Love Nina
-
-
